Welcome to PIoT-Assignment 2’s documentation!¶

New in version 0.1: Reception Menu and Master Menu

New in version 0.2: Local Database created and implemented

New in version 0.2a: Password Encryption implemented

New in version 0.2b: Input verification implemented and code documentation

New in version 0.3: Master Menu Class added

New in version 0.3a: Code clean up and documentation

New in version 0.4: Cloud Database connected and implemented

New in version 0.4a: Code clean up and documentation

New in version 0.4b: Flask API implemented

New in version 0.5: Socket Connection and Socket Utils implemented and documentation

New in version 0.5a: Flask code documentation and code clean up

New in version 0.6: Facial Recognition Implemented

New in version 0.6a: Code clean up and documenation

New in version 0.7: Voice to text and QR code implemented

New in version 0.7a: Bug fixing and code clean up

New in version 0.7b: Code documentation

New in version 0.8: Code cleanup and documentation

New in version 0.9: Graphical Visualisation of data implemented into Flask

New in version Final: Release: Code documented and code clean up

Reception Menu Class¶

Creates Menu class to display user login/registration menu

class Classes.reception_menu.Menu¶

This class handles all the menu functions for login/registration of a user.

face_menu()¶

Shows facial recognition registration menu

login_menu()¶

Takes the user input and verifies them. Once verified, the user is logged into the application.

main_menu()¶

Prints the main menu to the console and depending on the user’s choice sends them to the relevant menu or exits the program.

register_menu()¶

Requests a number of details from the user in order to create a new entry in the database.

verify_email()¶

Check that does not exist already and is valid

verify_fn()¶

Check that first name is valid

verify_ln()¶

Check that last name is valid

verify_password()¶

Check that password is valid

verify_username()¶

Check that username does not already exist or is invalid

Input Verification Class¶

Creates class for handling input verification

class Classes.input_verification.InputVerification¶

This module handles all the verification processes for the user inputs.

static email_valid(email_input)¶

Takes the email entered by the user and checks if it’s valid.

Parameters

email_input (str) – Stores the email value entered by the user.

Returns

Returns True/False based on whether or not the email is valid.

Return type

bool

static name_valid(name_input)¶

Takes either the first or last name value entered by the user and check if it’s valid.

Parameters

name_input (str) – Stores either the first or last name value that the user entered.

Returns

Returns True/False based on whether or not the name is valid.

Return type

bool

static pw_valid(pw_input)¶

Takes the password entered by the user and checks if it’s valid.

Parameters

pw_input (str) – Stores the password value entered by the user.

Returns

Returns True/False based on whether or not the password is valid.

Return type

bool

static username_valid(username_input)¶

Takes the username entered by the user and check if it’s valid.

Parameters

username_input (str) – Stores the username value entered by the user.

Returns

Returns True/False based on whether or not the username is valid.

Return type

bool

Password Encryption Class¶

Creates password encryption class https://www.cyberciti.biz/python-tutorials/securely-hash-passwords-in-python/ 23/4

class Classes.password_encryption.PasswordEncryption¶

This module handles the encryption for the passwords.

static encrypt(password)¶

Takes in a password input and encrypts it.

Parameters

password (str) – A string storing the password value.

Returns

Returns the encrypted password.

Return type

str

verify(usr_details)¶

Searches the database for the password that matches the entered username, then, compares the two password values and returns True/False based on whether they match or not.

Parameters

usr_details (list of str) – List containing the entered username and password.

Returns

Returns True/False based on whether or not the password is correct.

Return type

bool

Local Database Class¶

Create database class for handling local database functions

class Classes.local_database.LocalDatabase(db_name='User.db')¶

This module handles functions regarding the database.

create_table()¶

Creates USERS database table if one doesn’t already exist

email_exist(email)¶

Check if the email already exists in the database.

Parameters

email (str) – The email to be checked.

Returns

Returns True/False based on whether or not the email exists.

Return type

bool

get_password(username)¶

Get user’s password for verification purposes.

Parameters

username (str) – Username of the user to retrieve password for

Returns

Returns the encrypted password for a particular user

Return type

(str)

get_user_email(username)¶

Get the user’s email address by their username

Parameters

username (str) – Username of the user whose email we want to retrieve

Returns

Email address of the user

Return type

(str)

get_user_name(username)¶

Get the user’s first name by their username

Parameters

username (str) – Username of the user whose name we want to retrieve

Returns

First name of the user

Return type

(str)

insert_user(user_details)¶

Inserts a new user into the User database.

Parameters

  • user_details (list of str) – A list containing the details of a new user in the following

  • format – [First Name, Lastname, Email, Password]

read_db(query)¶

Used to search the database.

Parameters

  • column (str) – The name of the column to be searched.

  • query (str) – The SQL query for the desired information.

Returns

Returns the results of the query.

Return type

str

username_exist(username)¶

Check if the username already exists in the database.

Parameters

  • username (str) – The username to be checked.

  • search (bool) – Confirms/denies if the email exists in the database.

Returns

Returns True/False based on whether or not the email exists.

Return type

bool

Master Menu Class¶

Creates MasterPi menu class

class Classes.master_menu.MasterMenu(username)¶

This class handles the console application menu

borrow_book(user_id)¶

Select and borrow a book.

Parameters

user_id (str) – Currently logged in user

Returns

The book will be borrowed by the user.

menu()¶

This function handles the user interaction of the console application

Parameters

user_id (str) –

return_book(user_id, action)¶

Select and return a book

Parameters

  • user_id (str) – Currently logged in user

  • action (str) – Either “text” or “qr” for method of book ID input

Returns

The borrowed book will be returned to the system.

search_again(user_id, action)¶

Check if the user wants to search again

search_book(user_id, action)¶

Search for a book using text

Parameters

  • usr_id (int) – ID of the user borrowing books

  • action (str) – Either “text” or “voice” for search term input method

Returns

All matching books from the search query that have not been borrowed.

validate_book(book_id, user_id, action)¶

Checks whether a book ID is valid for borrowing/returning a book

Cloud Database Class¶

Creates CloudDatabase class

class Classes.cloud_database.CloudDatabase(connection=None)¶

Connects to the Google Cloud SQL database and handles associated functions

borrow_book(user_id, book_id)¶

Inserts a record of a book being borrowed into BookBorrowed

close()¶

Close database connection

create_user(username, name)¶

Creates a user record if the username does not already exist

Parameters

  • username (str) – Username

  • name (str) – Name

get_book(usr_in='')¶

Returns a matching book from the database

Parameters

usr_in (str) – Search terms for a book (title/author)

Returns

All matching books from the search query that have not been borrowed

get_borrowed_books(user_id)¶

Checks for all books that the user has borrowed

Parameters

user_id (str) – ID of the logged in user

Returns

All books that the user has borrowed at the moment

get_user_id(username, name)¶

Gets the currently logged in user’s ID

return_book(user_id, book_id)¶

Update a borrowed book to returned

Google Calendar Class¶

Creates GoogleCalendar class

class Classes.google_calendar.GoogleCalendar¶

Handles Google calendar related functions such as creating or showing events

delete_event(book_name)¶

Will delete the event when a book borrowed has been returned.

insert_event(book_name)¶

This method creates an event in the users calendar for when they need to return a book.

set_up()¶

Set up Google calendar access authorisation

show_events()¶

If a user wants to see their upcoming events, prints the 10 events they have coming up.

Socket Connection Class¶

Creates SocketConnection class

class Classes.socket_connection.SocketConnection¶

This class primarily handles the socket connection for both Master and Reception Pi

master_connecting()¶

This function makes the Master Pi listen for the connection of the Reception Pi.

reception_connecting(user)¶

This function makes the Reception Pi search and connect to the Master Pi’s IP

Parameter:

user (str): It passes the username to the Master Pi

Socket Utils Class¶

Creates SocketUtils class

class Classes.socket_utils.SocketUtils¶

This class handles the utilities of socket connection with json

static recv_json(socket)¶

Receives JSON data via socket

static send_json(socket, object_to_send)¶

Sends JSON data via socket

Voice to Text Class¶

Creates VoiceText class

class Classes.voice_text.VoiceText¶

Handles all the functionality regarding voice to text methods

get_device()¶

Finds microphone device ID by looking for the name of the microphone

voice_to_text()¶

This function converts all audio with Google Speech Recognition into text

QR Code Class¶

Creates QR class

class Classes.qr_code.QR¶

This module handles QR Code scanning to allow for the returning of books.

static scan_qr()¶

Scans a QR Code and returns the data from it

Returns

Returns the contents of the QR Code as a string.

Return type

str

Facial Recognition Class¶

Creates FacialRecognition class

class Classes.facial_recognition.FacialRecognition¶

Handles facial recognition features

static face_encoding()¶

Encodes facial data into pickle file

static face_scan()¶

Captures and recognises face

register_face(user)¶

Registers a new user’s face

Parameters

name (str) –

Returns

Associates the logged in user with the photos that will be taken.
